Home / About the Global Compact / Global Compact Logo

Global Compact Logo

Use by participants of the "We Support the Global Compact" logo is encouraged as a way to promote their commitment to the initiative and raise awareness of the UN Global Compact.  It can be used, for example, on corporate websites and pertinent printed materials.  Please note, however, that every use of a UN Global Compact logo, except the contextualized version of the logo for use in COPs, requires permission in advance from the UN Global Compact Office.  The version of the We Support logo for use in a participant's COP may be downloaded and used in a COP without prior permission.  Participants can request the use of a Global Compact logo using the online logo request.  We invite you to become familiar with the Global Compact Logo Policy and the Frequently Asked Questions below before requesting permission to use a Global Compact logo.
 
If you have been authorized to use either the Global Compact logo or the We Support logo on your website, we kindly invite you to link the logo to the Global Compact's own website: http://www.unglobalcompact.org.

Frequently Asked Questions

  • How can I request the Global Compact logo? 
  • Am I eligible to use the Global Compact logo? 
  • In what way should I use the Global Compact logo? 
  • Can I use the United Nations Logo?

How can I request the Global Compact logo?

How can I seek approval for use of a UN Global Compact logo?

To seek approval for use of a UN Global Compact logo:

  1. Login to the participant administration section of the UN Global Compact website using your organization’s username and password. Please note that support on the retrieval or (re)creation of login information is available via the Participant Administration section.
  2. Go to the “Submissions” tab and select “Logo Request”.
  3. Complete the request form and upload a sample of the desired use.
  4. Await a response from the UN Global Compact Office, which will typically take no more than three days.

What does the Global Compact Office consider when reviewing a request?

The Global Compact Office looks at :

  1. The accuracy of any information provided about the Global Compact in the material;
  2. Whether the colour and layout of the logo meets the Global Compact Logo Policy. See Global Compact Logo Policy - 4 Rules Governing the Reproduction and Display of the Logos and the Design Guidelines Manual (pdf).
  3. Whether the placement of the logo in the material would incorrectly imply any kind of endorsement by the Global Compact Office or that the Global Compact Office was the source of the material.

How long does it take to process my logo request?

It normally takes a maximum of 2-3 business days.  However, at busy times, such as when there is a major Global Compact event upcoming, it could take up to 7 business days.


Am I eligible to use the Global Compact logo?

My company/organization is a participant in the Global Compact.  Do we need to request permission to use the Global Compact logo?

According to the Global Compact Logo Policy, every use of a Global Compact logo requires permission in advance from the Global Compact Office. Seeking approval is simple and can be done via the online logo request.

A special contextualized version of the We Support logo has been introduced for use by participants in their COP without prior permission from the Global Compact Office.  Use of this logo is optional.  This logo can be downloaded at the Global Compact Logo Policy page.

Permission is still required for all other use of the Global Compact logos, including in the context of a participant's COP.

My company/organization has been given permission to use the We Support the Global Compact logo in our website.  Can we also use the logo in our company brochure?

Permission in advance is required in advance for each distinct use of a Global Compact logo.  This is because the Global Compact Office needs to review each intended use for its layout and context.  The Global Compact Office also records each approval.  Therefore, even organizations that have already received permission for a use in the past, should make a new request for other distinct uses of the same logo.  More than one approval can be sought in the same request. Seeking approval is simple and can be done via the online logo request.

Reprinting of a document containing a Global Compact logo does not require seeking new permission if the previous use had been approved.  Similarly, for documents that use the same template, such as a presentation, permission can be sought for the master copy, and approval, if given, will be valid for all versions produced using that template.  

I am not from a Global Compact participating company/organization.  Can I use a Global Compact logo?

Generally, only Global Compact participants and stakeholders are given permission to use a Global Compact logo.  However, exceptions can be made in appropriate circumstances where the use is consistent with the mission of the Global Compact.  Please submit a sample of the material with your request to gclogo@un.org.  Please also indicate where the logo would appear, the purpose of the material, its target audience, projected date of its release, etc.

I want to insert the Global Compact logo in my class paper/class presentation/thesis/class material etc.  Can I use the Global Compact logo?

Uses of a Global Compact logo in an academic context where the document in question containing the logo will not be published do not require permission of the Global Compact Office.  Such uses should make clear, however, that the appearance of the logo does not constitute an endorsement by the Global Compact of the paper/presentation/thesis/class material.  If the material will be published, permission of the Global Compact Office is required.

In what way should I use the Global Compact logo?

In what contexts could I be given permission to use a Global Compact logo?

Requests to use a Global Compact logo are mostly for use on participants' homepages, reports, brochures, and newsletters.  However, other uses are also possible.  We have received requests to use a Global Compact logo on signage, on products, on leaflets inside product packaging, on letterhead and business cards.  Creativity is welcome. 

What Global Compact logos exist?

There are four different kinds of Global Compact logos: the regular Global Compact logo with logotype, the regular Global Compact logo, the endorser (We Support) logo, and Local Network logos.  The We Support the Global Compact logo has been the logo most often approved for use by Global Compact participants.  A special contextualized version of the We Support logo has been developed for use, without advance permission, in participants' COPs.  In exceptional circumstances, such as where the Global Compact Office is directly involved in the activities described in the material, permission to use the regular Global Compact logo may be given.

The UN Logo

Can I use the UN logo?

All uses of the UN emblem by non-UN entities require the prior written authorization of the Secretary-General of the United Nations.  However, it should be noted that such requests are only very rarely granted.  Requests for such authorization should be submitted directly to the Office of Legal Affairs at the United Nations:

Director, General Legal Divison
Office of Legal Affairs
United Nations Secretariat
New York, NY 10017
Fax: 1-212-963-3155


Contact

gclogo@un.org

( Last Update: 14 July 2009)
